name: Microbiology Chapter 4 Quiz
description: Quiz questions for Microbiology Chapter 4, based on the content from OpenStax.
subject: Microbiology

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The term prokaryotes refers to which of the following?
options: unicellular organisms that have no nucleus
cells that resemble animal cells more than plant cells
questions.explanation: Prokaryotes are unicellular organisms that lack a nucleus.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The term microbiota refers to which of the following?
options: all microorganisms of the same species
all of the microorganisms involved in a symbiotic relationship
all microorganisms in a certain region of the human body
all microorganisms in a certain geographic region
questions.explanation: Microbiota refers to all microorganisms in a certain region of the human body.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following refers to the type of interaction between two prokaryotic populations in which one population benefits and the other is not affected?
questions.explanation: Commensalism is an interaction in which one population benefits and the other is not affected.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following describes Proteobacteria in domain Bacteria?
questions.explanation: Proteobacteria is a phylum in the domain Bacteria.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following Alphaproteobacteria is the cause of Rocky Mountain spotted fever and typhus?
questions.explanation: Rickettsia is the cause of Rocky Mountain spotted fever and typhus.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Class Betaproteobacteria includes all but which of the following genera?
questions.explanation: Campylobacter belongs to the class Epsilonproteobacteria, not Betaproteobacteria.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Haemophilus influenzae is a common cause of which of the following?
questions.explanation: Haemophilus influenzae is a common cause of upper respiratory tract infections.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is the organelle that spirochetes use to propel themselves?
questions.explanation: Spirochetes use an axial filament to propel themselves.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following bacteria are the most prevalent in the human gut?
questions.explanation: Bacteroides are the most prevalent bacteria in the human gut.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following refers to photosynthesis performed by bacteria with the use of water as the donor of electrons?
questions.explanation: Oxygenic photosynthesis is performed by bacteria with the use of water as the donor of electrons.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following bacterial species is classified as high G+C gram-positive?
questions.explanation: Corynebacterium diphtheriae is classified as high G+C gram-positive.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The term ‘deeply branching’ refers to which of the following?
options: the cellular shape of deeply branching bacteria
the position in the evolutionary tree of deeply branching bacteria
the ability of deeply branching bacteria to live in deep ocean waters
the pattern of growth in culture of deeply branching bacteria
questions.explanation: The term ‘deeply branching’ refers to the position in the evolutionary tree of deeply branching bacteria.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of these deeply branching bacteria is considered a polyextremophile?
questions.explanation: Deinococcus radiodurans is considered a polyextremophile.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Archaea and Bacteria are most similar in terms of their ________.
questions.explanation: Archaea and Bacteria are most similar in terms of their unicellular structure.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is true of archaea that produce methane?
options: They reduce carbon dioxide in the presence of nitrogen.
They live in the most extreme environments.
They have been discovered on Mars.
questions.explanation: Archaea that produce methane are always anaerobes.
